article:
This 'bibliography of anthropology' lists notable publications in the field of
anthropology, including its various subfields.

Anthropology is the study of humanity.
Described as "the most humanistic of sciences and the most scientific of the
humanities", it is considered to bridge the natural sciences, social
sciences and humanities, and draws upon a wide range of related
fields. In North America, anthropology is traditionally divided into four major
subdisciplines: biological anthropology, sociocultural anthropology, linguistic
anthropology and archaeology. Other academic traditions
use less broad definitions, where one or more of these fields are considered
separate, but related, disciplines.
headings: Some points of reference in related disciplines
